contentrichtext.text: {{more footnotes|date=February 2010}} {{Infobox President | name=Vyacheslav Anatolyevich Shtyrov | image = ShtyrovVA.JPG | nationality= [[Yakuts|Yakut]] | order=2nd [[List of Presidents of the Republic of Sakha|President of the Republic of Sakha]] | term_start=January 27, 2002 | term_end= May 31, 2010 | predecessor=[[Mikhail Nikolayev|Mikhail Efimovich Nikolayev]] | successor= [[Yegor Borisov]] | birth_date={{Birth date and age|1953|5|23|mf=y}} | birth_place=[[Khandyga]], [[Administrative divisions of Sakha|Tomponsky]] [[District#Russia|ulus]] of the [[Republics of the Soviet Union|Yakut ASSR]] | death_date= | death_place= | religion= [[Eastern Orthodoxy]] | spouse=[[Lidiya Shtyrova|Lidiya Ivanovna Shtyrova]] | party= [[United Russia]] (2007- Present) | vicepresident=[[Evgeniya Mikhailova|Evgeniya Isaevna Mikhailova]] }} '''Vyacheslav Anatolyevich Shtyrov''' ({{lang-ru|Вячеслав Анатольевич Штыров}}) (born May 23, 1953) is a Russian businessman who ran the diamond mining giant Almazy Rossii-Sakha (ALROSA ) from 1996 to 2002. He joined ALROSA in 1975. In 2004 it was reported that he owns 0.14% of ALROSA.<ref name="Russia's Richest 100 2004">{{cite news|url=http://www.forbes.com/finance/lists/75/2004/LIR.jhtml?passListId=75&passYear=2004&passListType=Person&uniqueId=N1XN&datatype=Person|title=Russia's Richest 100 2004 |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22|work=Forbes}}</ref> In 2002 he became a politician and was elected the president of the [[Sakha Republic]], a federal subject of [[Russia]]. He took office on January 27, 2002 after being elected in an election which took two rounds. He received 52.25% of the vote in the runoff. He left office on May 31, 2010 for personal reasons. Later he became the Chairman of the Federation Council at the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation.<ref name="Vyacheslav Shtyrov">{{cite web | url=http://www.rough-polished.com/en/exclusive/48088.html | title=ALROSA | publisher=http://www.rough-polished.com | accessdate=September 14, 2011}}</ref> ==Family== Shtyrov is married to [[Liliya Shtyrova|Liliya Ivanovna Shtyrova]], They have two daughters. Yulia and Tatiana. Tatiana is married to an Italian architect Gianluca Rubiolo. They have two daughter. == Wealth == In 2004, his wealth was estimated to be $410 million (12.5 Billion Rubles) <ref name="Russia's Richest 100 2004"/> == References == <references /> ==External links== *[http://sakha.gov.ru Official website of the government of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia)] {{s-start}} {{s-bef|before=[[Mikhail Nikolayev]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[President of the Sakha Republic]]|years=2002–2010}} {{s-aft|after=[[Yegor Borisov]]}} {{end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Shtyrov, Vyacheslav Anatolyevich | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Russian politician | DATE OF BIRTH =May 23, 1953 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Khandyga]], [[Administrative divisions of Sakha|Tomponsky]] [[District#Russia|ulus]] of the [[Republics of the Soviet Union|Yakut ASSR]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shtyrov, Vyacheslav Anatolyevich}} [[Category:Russian politicians]] [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Presidents of the Sakha Republic]] [[Category:United Russia politicians]] [[Category:Heads of the federal subjects of Russia]] {{russia-politician-stub}}
